title: Auxiliary Gift Shop ProMedica Toledo Hospital, Toledo, Ohio (OH), 43606

content.name: Auxiliary Gift Shop

address.addressOne:
ProMedica Toledo Hospital
2142 N. Cove Blvd.

content.description:
Welcome to the ProMedica Toledo Hospital Auxiliary Gift Shop, a project of the ProMedica Toledo Hospital and Russell J. Ebeid Children’s Hospital Auxiliary. The Auxiliary Gift Shop provides a convenient retail shopping experience for our guests and employees. Proceeds support Auxiliary funded patient services and projects to enhance care and comfort. The Gift Shop is located inside Entrance A of Toledo Hospital, on the first floor, next to the cafeteria.

Stocked with fresh flowers, balloons, and a variety of sundries, gifts, and seasonal items, you are sure to find the perfect gift for your loved one. If you would like to send a gift to a patient on our campus, you can place a phone order. Click here to see some of our popular gift items. VISA, MasterCard, Discover and American Express are accepted.

Flower & Gift Deliveries

Gifts and fresh flowers can be delivered to patient rooms. Phone orders placed by 4 p.m. will be delivered to a patient room the same day. There is no delivery fee.

Fresh flowers cannot be delivered to patients in Intensive Care Units, however mylar balloons are permitted. Delivery for on-campus only.

Coldwater Obstetrics | Gynecology - Maternity Services, Obstetrics/Gynecology, Well Women Care - 370 East Chicago St., Coldwater, Michigan (MI), 49036

content.name: Coldwater Obstetrics | Gynecology
content.description:
The Coldwater Obstetrics and Gynecology Office on the campus of ProMedica Coldwater Regional Hospital is an outpatient facility with a team of health care specialists who offer you compassionate, high-quality care.

About this Location

Our diverse services help women at every stage of life. From preventive Pap tests, family planning and birth control, to abnormal bleeding, pelvic pain and menopause symptoms, our experts are here to help.

Virtual Tour

Take a virtual tour of our labor and delivery unit and obstetrics & gynecology office.

Comprehensive Centers for Pain Management
Coping Center - Defiance Regional Hospital - Inpatient Psychiatric Services, Medication Management, Psychiatry - 1200 Ralston Ave., Defiance, Ohio (OH), 43512

content.name: Coping Center - Defiance Regional Hospital
content.description:
The ProMedica Defiance Regional Hospital Coping Center provides patients with a full range of adult inpatient psychiatric services. Our goal is to partner with patients to help them deal with the stressors of life in a safe and caring environment.

Accommodations

  • There are 10 patient rooms in the department, all are private and spacious.
  • Each room has a private bathroom, sofa, desk area, and chair.
  • Common areas for dining, TV, telephone services, and other activities
  • Outdoor patio (weather permitting)

Nurses' station

Private room

Common area and kitchen

Activity room

Services

  • Offers patient-centered care designed to meet individual needs
  • Treatment team includes Psychiatrists, Psychologist, Nurses, Social Workers, and Activity Therapists.
  • Structured programs in a group setting that use art, music, and other activities to help build healthy coping skills

    • Connecting to Services

  • Call 911
  • Go to the nearest Emergency Center
  • Suicide Prevention Hotline 1-800-273-8255

title: Cystic Fibrosis Center of Northwest Ohio

content.name: Cystic Fibrosis Center of Northwest Ohio
content.description:
Why Choose Northwest Ohio Cystic Fibrosis Center

ProMedica's Cystic Fibrosis Center is accredited by the National Cystic Fibrosis Foundation. We serve patients from the 21-county geographic regions of northwest Ohio and southeast Michigan. Although we are a pediatric office, our Cystic Fibrosis Center provides care for pediatric and adult patients. We use a multi-disciplinary approach to meet all of your cystic fibrosis related care needs. Our care team consists of pediatric and adult physicians, nurse coordinators, social workers, dieticians, respiratory therapists and research coordinators. To provide you with the best patient outcomes, our CF Center participates in the Cystic Fibrosis Foundation Patient Registry. This Registry tracks patient outcomes, enabling informed decision making about quality improvement and standardized care for patients with CF.

Our long-established program has also received Quality Improvement Awards from the Cystic Fibrosis Foundation for sustaining quality improvement work that has led to better health outcomes for people with cystic fibrosis.

In 2006, a robust clinical research program was developed within our Cystic Fibrosis Care Center, in conjunction with the Cystic Fibrosis Therapeutics Development Network (TDN). The TDN was created by the CF Foundation and is one of the largest CF clinical networks in the world, bringing together experts from across the country to evaluate the safety and efficacy of new CF therapies. Our center is currently enrolling patients in research studies aimed at developing new gene-targeted therapies to correct the basic defect that causes cystic fibrosis. By working in collaboration with the Cystic Fibrosis Foundation and industry sponsors, we hope to one-day find a cure for CF.

Contact

Lead Research Coordinator: Kelly Hoot, RN, BSN - Kelly.hoot@promedica.org
Adult Coordinator: Amanda Schreiner RN, BSN - Amanda.schreiner@promedica.org
Pediatric Coordinator: Tyger Adoure-Zehaim RN, BSN - Tyger.Adoure-Zehaim@promedica.org

title: Eidi Family Rehabilitation Center | ProMedica

content.name: Eidi Family Rehabilitation Center
content.description:
A State-of-the-art Facility Made for You

Our renovated space was designed with you and your family in mind.

Our center includes:

  • Private and semi-private rooms with accommodations for overnight guests.
  • A rehabilitation gym.
  • A large, 3-room transition apartment.

We encourage families to visit the facility before making a decision on a rehabilitation facility. To be sure staff members are available to answer your questions, we suggest you contact us to schedule a tour in advance.

Please call 419-824-6066 for more information or to arrange a tour.

Take a Virtual Tour

Inpatient Rehab to Help You Reach Your Highest Potential

You want care focused on your function and independence. Our expert rehab staff of doctors, nurses, therapists, and case managers provides you with needed support as you adjust to changes from an illness or injury.

Our staff is highly trained to treat various conditions, including:

  • Stroke.
  • Brain injury.
  • Spinal cord injury.
  • Multiple trauma.
  • Fracture/joint replacement.
  • Amputation.
  • Complicated orthopaedic conditions.

Our state-of-the-art facility is CARF accredited (Commission on Accreditation of Rehabilitation Facilities) and specializes in acute care rehabilitation. We use intensive therapy and education to help you reach your highest potential.

You’ll have access to:

  • 24-hour nursing care.
  • Daily physician visits.
  • Daily physical, occupational or speech therapy.

Robotic Exoskeleton Therapy and Rehab

The Eidi Family Rehabilitation Center offers the first-ever FDA approved, wearable robotic exoskeleton. The EksoNR™ helps stroke and spinal cord injury patients gain mobility quicker, and gain more confidence and independence as well. The device uses support mechanisms and real-time adjustments so that patients are supported as they re-learn correct step patterns, weight shifting and posture.

Learn More

Frequently Asked Questions

What sets Eidi Family Rehabilitation Center apart from other programs?

Eidi Family Rehabilitation Center features spacious private and semi-private rooms with ample space for relaxing and family visiting. In addition, we have a 3-room transition apartment where patients can test their readiness for independent living. The goal of the transition apartment is to give patients the opportunity to practice tasks and become confident in their abilities prior to discharge.

Do you have specific admission guidelines?

We use pre-admission criteria established by the Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services. This ensures that the patients entering the program will benefit from participation. Our personnel work closely with families, discharge planners, and other medical and rehabilitation professionals to gather information and plan treatment programs for the earliest discharge possible.

Does your staff have experience treating patients with specific diagnoses?

Our team of experts have received extensive training in rehabilitation interventions for patients after stroke, brain injury, spinal cord injury, multiple traumas, complicated orthopaedic conditions, hip fracture, amputation, burn, pain, or other illness. Our team of physicians, nurses and therapists have hundreds of years of combined clinical experience in rehabilitation with proven results. Over 80% of our patients return home upon discharge.

How much therapy is provided?

Therapy involves many components beyond the traditional physical therapy, occupational therapy and speech-language pathology available in many hospitals. Rehabilitation nursing, case management and therapeutic recreation also work as members of our interdisciplinary team to provide a comprehensive rehabilitation program for inpatients. Therapies are scheduled daily, with the goal of patients working toward being able to tolerate three hours of therapy a day or 900 minutes per week.

Who makes up the medical staff at Eidi Family Rehabilitation Center?

Our medical directors are board-certified physical medicine and rehabilitation physicians. In addition to physical medicine and rehabilitation physicians, internal medicine physicians are also available to care for patients’ medical needs while they are in our care. Since we are located on the Flower Hospital campus, patients have convenient access to emergency and consultative services. You can have peace of mind knowing you will have prompt attention to your medical needs.

What’s the family’s role in rehabilitation?

Family members and friends are considered a special part of the treatment process. Staff members work closely with families during education sessions to provide hands-on learning of skills and adjustment techniques in preparation for the patient’s discharge. During the patient’s stay, families are encouraged to assist the patient with bathing, toileting, dressing, and exercise after instruction by staff.

How do you keep patients and families informed?

A case manager serves as a liaison, facilitating communication between staff, families and patients. At weekly conferences, team members discuss the patient’s progress, set new goals and plan for discharge. The length of a patient’s stay varies widely. The case manager shares progress reports with patients and families at regular intervals. Meetings with the physicians, therapy team, patient and family are strongly encouraged.

When are visitors allowed?

The primary caregiver is welcome at any time with accommodations for overnight stays if necessary. Other visitors are welcome Mon. – Fri., 5 – 8:30 p.m., and Sat. – Sun., noon – 8:30 p.m.

Who pays for services at Eidi Family Rehabilitation Center?

Generally, services are covered by most insurance companies. We also accept patients covered under Medicare and Medicaid programs. Insurance is verified prior to admission. For questions, please call your insurance company.

What happens on the day of discharge?

To ease the discharge transition, the case manager will work with the patient and family to arrange for continuing outpatient or in-home treatment support as indicated. Community resources are arranged prior to discharge.

title: Jobst Medication Therapy Management - Adrian - Anticoagulation Services, Medication Management - ProMedica Charles and Virginia Hickman Hospital, Adrian, Michigan (MI), 49221

content.name: Jobst Medication Therapy Management - Adrian

address.addressOne:
ProMedica Charles and Virginia Hickman Hospital
5640 N. Adrian Hwy.

content.description:
Jobst Medication Therapy Management is comprised of specially trained clinical pharmacists and support staff that work closely with you and your provider to give you dedicated management of your medications. Together we will manage your medications by making sure you receive effective treatment, routine monitoring and ongoing education.

Our clinical pharmacists will:

  • Answer any questions you may have about your medications.
  • Verify your medications are safe to take together.
  • Review your lab values and medical history to ensure safe medication use.
  • Resolve any side effects that you are experiencing.
  • Determine if there are cost-saving opportunities.
  • Provide education to you and your family, including:
      • Review each medication’s dose, frequency, route, technique, and reason for taking.
      • Review your over-the-counter medications, supplements, and herbals.
      • Provide you with an updated medication list during the visit.
  • Discuss ways to help you remember to take your medications.
  • Discuss how to decrease your risk of falls if taking certain medications that can contribute.
  • Help to quit smoking.
  • Provide weight loss support.
  • Offer vaccine recommendations based on your age and medical history.

Our Services

Our clinical pharmacists work closely with your provider to help manage the medications that you take for:

  • Asthma
  • Blood flow such as anticoagulants (blood thinners)
  • Blood pressure
  • Cholesterol
  • COPD
  • Diabetes
  • Heart attack
  • Heart failure
  • Mood

Together we will manage your medications by making sure you receive effective treatment, routine monitoring and ongoing education.

Our clinical pharmacists will:

  • Answer any questions you may have about your medications.
  • Verify your medications are safe to take together.
  • Review your lab values and medical history to ensure safe medication use.
  • Resolve any side effects that you are experiencing.
  • Determine if there are cost-saving opportunities.
  • Provide education to you and your family, including:
      • Review each medication’s dose, frequency, route, technique, and reason for taking.
      • Review your over-the-counter medications, supplements, and herbals.
      • Provide you with an updated medication list during the visit.
  • Discuss ways to help you remember to take your medications.
  • Discuss how to decrease your risk of falls if taking certain medications that can contribute.
  • Help to quit smoking.
  • Provide weight loss support.
  • Offer vaccine recommendations based on your age and medical history.

Our Services

Our clinical pharmacists work closely with your provider to help manage the medications that you take for:

  • Asthma
  • Blood flow such as anticoagulants (blood thinners)
  • Blood pressure
  • Cholesterol
  • COPD
  • Diabetes
  • Heart attack
  • Heart failure
  • Mood

title: Auxiliary Gift Shop ProMedica Toledo Hospital, Toledo, Ohio (OH), 43606

content.name: Auxiliary Gift Shop

address.addressOne:
ProMedica Toledo Hospital
2142 N. Cove Blvd.

content.description:
Welcome to the ProMedica Toledo Hospital Auxiliary Gift Shop, a project of the ProMedica Toledo Hospital and Russell J. Ebeid Children’s Hospital Auxiliary. The Auxiliary Gift Shop provides a convenient retail shopping experience for our guests and employees. Proceeds support Auxiliary funded patient services and projects to enhance care and comfort. The Gift Shop is located inside Entrance A of Toledo Hospital, on the first floor, next to the cafeteria.

Stocked with fresh flowers, balloons, and a variety of sundries, gifts, and seasonal items, you are sure to find the perfect gift for your loved one. If you would like to send a gift to a patient on our campus, you can place a phone order. Click here to see some of our popular gift items. VISA, MasterCard, Discover and American Express are accepted.

Flower & Gift Deliveries

Gifts and fresh flowers can be delivered to patient rooms. Phone orders placed by 4 p.m. will be delivered to a patient room the same day. There is no delivery fee.

Fresh flowers cannot be delivered to patients in Intensive Care Units, however mylar balloons are permitted. Delivery for on-campus only.

title: Cystic Fibrosis Center of Northwest Ohio

content.name: Cystic Fibrosis Center of Northwest Ohio
content.description:
Why Choose Northwest Ohio Cystic Fibrosis Center

ProMedica's Cystic Fibrosis Center is accredited by the National Cystic Fibrosis Foundation. We serve patients from the 21-county geographic regions of northwest Ohio and southeast Michigan. Although we are a pediatric office, our Cystic Fibrosis Center provides care for pediatric and adult patients. We use a multi-disciplinary approach to meet all of your cystic fibrosis related care needs. Our care team consists of pediatric and adult physicians, nurse coordinators, social workers, dieticians, respiratory therapists and research coordinators. To provide you with the best patient outcomes, our CF Center participates in the Cystic Fibrosis Foundation Patient Registry. This Registry tracks patient outcomes, enabling informed decision making about quality improvement and standardized care for patients with CF.

Our long-established program has also received Quality Improvement Awards from the Cystic Fibrosis Foundation for sustaining quality improvement work that has led to better health outcomes for people with cystic fibrosis.

In 2006, a robust clinical research program was developed within our Cystic Fibrosis Care Center, in conjunction with the Cystic Fibrosis Therapeutics Development Network (TDN). The TDN was created by the CF Foundation and is one of the largest CF clinical networks in the world, bringing together experts from across the country to evaluate the safety and efficacy of new CF therapies. Our center is currently enrolling patients in research studies aimed at developing new gene-targeted therapies to correct the basic defect that causes cystic fibrosis. By working in collaboration with the Cystic Fibrosis Foundation and industry sponsors, we hope to one-day find a cure for CF.

Contact

Lead Research Coordinator: Kelly Hoot, RN, BSN - Kelly.hoot@promedica.org
Adult Coordinator: Amanda Schreiner RN, BSN - Amanda.schreiner@promedica.org
Pediatric Coordinator: Tyger Adoure-Zehaim RN, BSN - Tyger.Adoure-Zehaim@promedica.org

title: Eidi Family Rehabilitation Center | ProMedica

content.name: Eidi Family Rehabilitation Center
content.description:
A State-of-the-art Facility Made for You

Our renovated space was designed with you and your family in mind.

Our center includes:

  • Private and semi-private rooms with accommodations for overnight guests.
  • A rehabilitation gym.
  • A large, 3-room transition apartment.

We encourage families to visit the facility before making a decision on a rehabilitation facility. To be sure staff members are available to answer your questions, we suggest you contact us to schedule a tour in advance.

Please call 419-824-6066 for more information or to arrange a tour.

Take a Virtual Tour

Inpatient Rehab to Help You Reach Your Highest Potential

You want care focused on your function and independence. Our expert rehab staff of doctors, nurses, therapists, and case managers provides you with needed support as you adjust to changes from an illness or injury.

Our staff is highly trained to treat various conditions, including:

  • Stroke.
  • Brain injury.
  • Spinal cord injury.
  • Multiple trauma.
  • Fracture/joint replacement.
  • Amputation.
  • Complicated orthopaedic conditions.

Our state-of-the-art facility is CARF accredited (Commission on Accreditation of Rehabilitation Facilities) and specializes in acute care rehabilitation. We use intensive therapy and education to help you reach your highest potential.

You’ll have access to:

  • 24-hour nursing care.
  • Daily physician visits.
  • Daily physical, occupational or speech therapy.

Robotic Exoskeleton Therapy and Rehab

The Eidi Family Rehabilitation Center offers the first-ever FDA approved, wearable robotic exoskeleton. The EksoNR™ helps stroke and spinal cord injury patients gain mobility quicker, and gain more confidence and independence as well. The device uses support mechanisms and real-time adjustments so that patients are supported as they re-learn correct step patterns, weight shifting and posture.

Learn More

Frequently Asked Questions

What sets Eidi Family Rehabilitation Center apart from other programs?

Eidi Family Rehabilitation Center features spacious private and semi-private rooms with ample space for relaxing and family visiting. In addition, we have a 3-room transition apartment where patients can test their readiness for independent living. The goal of the transition apartment is to give patients the opportunity to practice tasks and become confident in their abilities prior to discharge.

Do you have specific admission guidelines?

We use pre-admission criteria established by the Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services. This ensures that the patients entering the program will benefit from participation. Our personnel work closely with families, discharge planners, and other medical and rehabilitation professionals to gather information and plan treatment programs for the earliest discharge possible.

Does your staff have experience treating patients with specific diagnoses?

Our team of experts have received extensive training in rehabilitation interventions for patients after stroke, brain injury, spinal cord injury, multiple traumas, complicated orthopaedic conditions, hip fracture, amputation, burn, pain, or other illness. Our team of physicians, nurses and therapists have hundreds of years of combined clinical experience in rehabilitation with proven results. Over 80% of our patients return home upon discharge.

How much therapy is provided?

Therapy involves many components beyond the traditional physical therapy, occupational therapy and speech-language pathology available in many hospitals. Rehabilitation nursing, case management and therapeutic recreation also work as members of our interdisciplinary team to provide a comprehensive rehabilitation program for inpatients. Therapies are scheduled daily, with the goal of patients working toward being able to tolerate three hours of therapy a day or 900 minutes per week.

Who makes up the medical staff at Eidi Family Rehabilitation Center?

Our medical directors are board-certified physical medicine and rehabilitation physicians. In addition to physical medicine and rehabilitation physicians, internal medicine physicians are also available to care for patients’ medical needs while they are in our care. Since we are located on the Flower Hospital campus, patients have convenient access to emergency and consultative services. You can have peace of mind knowing you will have prompt attention to your medical needs.

What’s the family’s role in rehabilitation?

Family members and friends are considered a special part of the treatment process. Staff members work closely with families during education sessions to provide hands-on learning of skills and adjustment techniques in preparation for the patient’s discharge. During the patient’s stay, families are encouraged to assist the patient with bathing, toileting, dressing, and exercise after instruction by staff.

How do you keep patients and families informed?

A case manager serves as a liaison, facilitating communication between staff, families and patients. At weekly conferences, team members discuss the patient’s progress, set new goals and plan for discharge. The length of a patient’s stay varies widely. The case manager shares progress reports with patients and families at regular intervals. Meetings with the physicians, therapy team, patient and family are strongly encouraged.

When are visitors allowed?

The primary caregiver is welcome at any time with accommodations for overnight stays if necessary. Other visitors are welcome Mon. – Fri., 5 – 8:30 p.m., and Sat. – Sun., noon – 8:30 p.m.

Who pays for services at Eidi Family Rehabilitation Center?

Generally, services are covered by most insurance companies. We also accept patients covered under Medicare and Medicaid programs. Insurance is verified prior to admission. For questions, please call your insurance company.

What happens on the day of discharge?

To ease the discharge transition, the case manager will work with the patient and family to arrange for continuing outpatient or in-home treatment support as indicated. Community resources are arranged prior to discharge.

  • Verify your medications are safe to take together.
  • Review your lab values and medical history to ensure safe medication use.
  • Resolve any side effects that you are experiencing.
  • Determine if there are cost-saving opportunities.
  • Provide education to you and your family, including:
      • Review each medication’s dose, frequency, route, technique, and reason for taking.
      • Review your over-the-counter medications, supplements, and herbals.
      • Provide you with an updated medication list during the visit.
  • Discuss ways to help you remember to take your medications.
  • Discuss how to decrease your risk of falls if taking certain medications that can contribute.
  • Help to quit smoking.
  • Provide weight loss support.
  • Offer vaccine recommendations based on your age and medical history.

Our Services

Our clinical pharmacists work closely with your provider to help manage the medications that you take for:

  • Asthma
  • Blood flow such as anticoagulants (blood thinners)
  • Blood pressure
  • Cholesterol
  • COPD
  • Diabetes
  • Heart attack
  • Heart failure
  • Mood

title: Auxiliary Gift Shop ProMedica Toledo Hospital, Toledo, Ohio (OH), 43606

content.name: Auxiliary Gift Shop

address.addressOne:
ProMedica Toledo Hospital
2142 N. Cove Blvd.

content.description:
Welcome to the ProMedica Toledo Hospital Auxiliary Gift Shop, a project of the ProMedica Toledo Hospital and Russell J. Ebeid Children’s Hospital Auxiliary. The Auxiliary Gift Shop provides a convenient retail shopping experience for our guests and employees. Proceeds support Auxiliary funded patient services and projects to enhance care and comfort. The Gift Shop is located inside Entrance A of Toledo Hospital, on the first floor, next to the cafeteria.

Stocked with fresh flowers, balloons, and a variety of sundries, gifts, and seasonal items, you are sure to find the perfect gift for your loved one. If you would like to send a gift to a patient on our campus, you can place a phone order. Click here to see some of our popular gift items. VISA, MasterCard, Discover and American Express are accepted.

Flower & Gift Deliveries

Gifts and fresh flowers can be delivered to patient rooms. Phone orders placed by 4 p.m. will be delivered to a patient room the same day. There is no delivery fee.

Fresh flowers cannot be delivered to patients in Intensive Care Units, however mylar balloons are permitted. Delivery for on-campus only.

title: Cystic Fibrosis Center of Northwest Ohio

content.name: Cystic Fibrosis Center of Northwest Ohio
content.description:
Why Choose Northwest Ohio Cystic Fibrosis Center

ProMedica's Cystic Fibrosis Center is accredited by the National Cystic Fibrosis Foundation. We serve patients from the 21-county geographic regions of northwest Ohio and southeast Michigan. Although we are a pediatric office, our Cystic Fibrosis Center provides care for pediatric and adult patients. We use a multi-disciplinary approach to meet all of your cystic fibrosis related care needs. Our care team consists of pediatric and adult physicians, nurse coordinators, social workers, dieticians, respiratory therapists and research coordinators. To provide you with the best patient outcomes, our CF Center participates in the Cystic Fibrosis Foundation Patient Registry. This Registry tracks patient outcomes, enabling informed decision making about quality improvement and standardized care for patients with CF.

Our long-established program has also received Quality Improvement Awards from the Cystic Fibrosis Foundation for sustaining quality improvement work that has led to better health outcomes for people with cystic fibrosis.

In 2006, a robust clinical research program was developed within our Cystic Fibrosis Care Center, in conjunction with the Cystic Fibrosis Therapeutics Development Network (TDN). The TDN was created by the CF Foundation and is one of the largest CF clinical networks in the world, bringing together experts from across the country to evaluate the safety and efficacy of new CF therapies. Our center is currently enrolling patients in research studies aimed at developing new gene-targeted therapies to correct the basic defect that causes cystic fibrosis. By working in collaboration with the Cystic Fibrosis Foundation and industry sponsors, we hope to one-day find a cure for CF.

Contact

Lead Research Coordinator: Kelly Hoot, RN, BSN - Kelly.hoot@promedica.org
Adult Coordinator: Amanda Schreiner RN, BSN - Amanda.schreiner@promedica.org
Pediatric Coordinator: Tyger Adoure-Zehaim RN, BSN - Tyger.Adoure-Zehaim@promedica.org

title: Eidi Family Rehabilitation Center | ProMedica

content.name: Eidi Family Rehabilitation Center
content.description:
A State-of-the-art Facility Made for You

Our renovated space was designed with you and your family in mind.

Our center includes:

  • Private and semi-private rooms with accommodations for overnight guests.
  • A rehabilitation gym.
  • A large, 3-room transition apartment.

We encourage families to visit the facility before making a decision on a rehabilitation facility. To be sure staff members are available to answer your questions, we suggest you contact us to schedule a tour in advance.

Please call 419-824-6066 for more information or to arrange a tour.

Take a Virtual Tour

Inpatient Rehab to Help You Reach Your Highest Potential

You want care focused on your function and independence. Our expert rehab staff of doctors, nurses, therapists, and case managers provides you with needed support as you adjust to changes from an illness or injury.

Our staff is highly trained to treat various conditions, including:

  • Stroke.
  • Brain injury.
  • Spinal cord injury.
  • Multiple trauma.
  • Fracture/joint replacement.
  • Amputation.
  • Complicated orthopaedic conditions.

Our state-of-the-art facility is CARF accredited (Commission on Accreditation of Rehabilitation Facilities) and specializes in acute care rehabilitation. We use intensive therapy and education to help you reach your highest potential.

You’ll have access to:

  • 24-hour nursing care.
  • Daily physician visits.
  • Daily physical, occupational or speech therapy.

Robotic Exoskeleton Therapy and Rehab

The Eidi Family Rehabilitation Center offers the first-ever FDA approved, wearable robotic exoskeleton. The EksoNR™ helps stroke and spinal cord injury patients gain mobility quicker, and gain more confidence and independence as well. The device uses support mechanisms and real-time adjustments so that patients are supported as they re-learn correct step patterns, weight shifting and posture.

Learn More

Frequently Asked Questions

What sets Eidi Family Rehabilitation Center apart from other programs?

Eidi Family Rehabilitation Center features spacious private and semi-private rooms with ample space for relaxing and family visiting. In addition, we have a 3-room transition apartment where patients can test their readiness for independent living. The goal of the transition apartment is to give patients the opportunity to practice tasks and become confident in their abilities prior to discharge.

Do you have specific admission guidelines?

We use pre-admission criteria established by the Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services. This ensures that the patients entering the program will benefit from participation. Our personnel work closely with families, discharge planners, and other medical and rehabilitation professionals to gather information and plan treatment programs for the earliest discharge possible.

Does your staff have experience treating patients with specific diagnoses?

Our team of experts have received extensive training in rehabilitation interventions for patients after stroke, brain injury, spinal cord injury, multiple traumas, complicated orthopaedic conditions, hip fracture, amputation, burn, pain, or other illness. Our team of physicians, nurses and therapists have hundreds of years of combined clinical experience in rehabilitation with proven results. Over 80% of our patients return home upon discharge.

How much therapy is provided?

Therapy involves many components beyond the traditional physical therapy, occupational therapy and speech-language pathology available in many hospitals. Rehabilitation nursing, case management and therapeutic recreation also work as members of our interdisciplinary team to provide a comprehensive rehabilitation program for inpatients. Therapies are scheduled daily, with the goal of patients working toward being able to tolerate three hours of therapy a day or 900 minutes per week.

Who makes up the medical staff at Eidi Family Rehabilitation Center?

Our medical directors are board-certified physical medicine and rehabilitation physicians. In addition to physical medicine and rehabilitation physicians, internal medicine physicians are also available to care for patients’ medical needs while they are in our care. Since we are located on the Flower Hospital campus, patients have convenient access to emergency and consultative services. You can have peace of mind knowing you will have prompt attention to your medical needs.

What’s the family’s role in rehabilitation?

Family members and friends are considered a special part of the treatment process. Staff members work closely with families during education sessions to provide hands-on learning of skills and adjustment techniques in preparation for the patient’s discharge. During the patient’s stay, families are encouraged to assist the patient with bathing, toileting, dressing, and exercise after instruction by staff.

How do you keep patients and families informed?

A case manager serves as a liaison, facilitating communication between staff, families and patients. At weekly conferences, team members discuss the patient’s progress, set new goals and plan for discharge. The length of a patient’s stay varies widely. The case manager shares progress reports with patients and families at regular intervals. Meetings with the physicians, therapy team, patient and family are strongly encouraged.

When are visitors allowed?

The primary caregiver is welcome at any time with accommodations for overnight stays if necessary. Other visitors are welcome Mon. – Fri., 5 – 8:30 p.m., and Sat. – Sun., noon – 8:30 p.m.

Who pays for services at Eidi Family Rehabilitation Center?

Generally, services are covered by most insurance companies. We also accept patients covered under Medicare and Medicaid programs. Insurance is verified prior to admission. For questions, please call your insurance company.

What happens on the day of discharge?

To ease the discharge transition, the case manager will work with the patient and family to arrange for continuing outpatient or in-home treatment support as indicated. Community resources are arranged prior to discharge.

      • Review each medication’s dose, frequency, route, technique, and reason for taking.
      • Review your over-the-counter medications, supplements, and herbals.
      • Provide you with an updated medication list during the visit.
  • Discuss ways to help you remember to take your medications.
  • Discuss how to decrease your risk of falls if taking certain medications that can contribute.
  • Help to quit smoking.
  • Provide weight loss support.
  • Offer vaccine recommendations based on your age and medical history.

Our Services

Our clinical pharmacists work closely with your provider to help manage the medications that you take for:

  • Asthma
  • Blood flow such as anticoagulants (blood thinners)
  • Blood pressure
  • Cholesterol
  • COPD
  • Diabetes
  • Heart attack
  • Heart failure
  • Mood

content.name: Pediatric Hematology/Oncology Program at Ebeid Children's Hospital
content.description:
The Pediatric Hematology/Oncology Program at the Debbie Brass Children’s Cancer Center located at ProMedica Russell J. Ebeid Children’s Hospital provides comprehensive, compassionate care and support for children diagnosed with cancer, blood disorders and bone marrow failure syndromes. From diagnosis through recovery, from newborns to young adults, our mission is to treat and cure cancer and blood diseases by understanding the special physical and emotional needs of both the patients and their families.

Our pediatric cancer center is the only member in the region of the Children’s Oncology Group (COG). COG is the world’s largest organization devoted exclusively to pediatric cancer clinical trials and research and is supported by the National Cancer Institute.

title: Pediatric Specialty Services - Muscular Dystrophy, Pediatric Down Syndrome, Pediatric Genetics, Pediatric Infectious Disease, Pediatric Neurology, Pediatric Physical Medicine, Pediatric Rehabilitation, Pediatric Rheumatology - 2150 W. Central Ave., Toledo, Ohio (OH), 43606

content.name: Pediatric Specialty Services
content.description:
ProMedica Pediatric Specialty Services makes it convenient to get expert, specialized care for children. We offer a wide range of services on the second floor of the Center for Health Services, close to ProMedica Russell J. Ebeid Children’s Hospital. Our family-centered care gives families access to leading-edge treatments from compassionate care teams.

Services We Provide

Pediatric Physical Medicine and Rehabilitation

Our pediatric physiatrist and healthcare staff coordinator provide care for children with physical disabilities to diagnose, treat and educate. We help them reach their functional goals to improve their quality of life.

Pediatric Genetics

Our affiliated pediatric geneticist and support team, including genetic counselors and registered nurse coordinators, provide care for children to diagnose, treat and provide education on pediatric genetic disorders.

Pediatric Rheumatology

Our affiliated pediatric rheumatologist and support team, including a RN coordinator and social worker, provide care for children to diagnose, treat and provide education on pediatric rheumatology disorders.

Adult and Pediatric Muscular Dystrophy Center

Our physiatrists and pediatric neurologist work with the Muscular Dystrophy Association and multi-disciplinary team that includes an orthopaedist, registered nurse coordinator, social worker and physical and occupational therapist. Together, they diagnose, treat, educate and coordinate care for patients with muscular dystrophy diseases.

Pediatric Neurology Seizure Clinic

Our pediatric neurologist and registered nurse coordinator diagnose, treat and pediatric patients with neurological diseases, with a special focus on seizure disorders.

Pediatric Down Syndrome Clinic

Our pediatric developmental specialist and registered nurse coordinator provide care for children with Down syndrome. We coordinate their care and help them reach their functional goals with an emphasis on quality of life.

Pediatric Infectious Disease

Our affiliated team of infectious disease specialists, including a physician, advanced practice provider, and registered nurse coordinator, diagnose, treat and provide education on children’s illnesses associated with infectious disease.

ProMedica Bay Park Hospital

content.name: ProMedica Bay Park Hospital
content.description:
Founded in 2001, ProMedica Bay Park Hospital is a community hospital serving the city of Oregon, Ohio, and our rural communities east of the Maumee River.

Our medical campus features:

  • A state-of-the-art hospital with 72 private beds.
  • A professional office building dedicated to doctors' offices and outpatient rehabilitation.
  • A treatment and diagnos​tic center.

ProMedica Bay Park Hospital was designed with your comfort and healing in mind, with wider hallways, single-patient rooms, and an abundance of natural light. Sofa beds in patient rooms and birthing suites, with plenty of room for baby and other family members, are just two examples of how we put family first.
content.volunteer:
Volunteers provide many meaningful services at Bay Park Hospital. Most importantly, they connect to our patients and their loved ones. By volunteering, you give your time and talents to your neighbors, and gain a sense of purpose and fulfillment. We thank you.

Valuable services to which you may contribute:

  • Guest guides.
  • Gift shop.
  • Support services.
  • Patient care services.
  • Advisory councils.

The Volunteer Resource Department helps the volunteer select an assignment that will best meet his/her talents and interests during the personal interview process. Some department directors reserve the right to interview prospective volunteers and make the final decision about their placement.

Volunteer Requirements

All volunteers must:

  • Be at least 16 years old.
  • Present proof of the 2nd Pfizer/Moderna vaccination or single dose of the Johnson & Johnson vaccination
  • Have a PPD 2-step/T-Stop (Tuberculin)
  • Present proof of Flu immunization during the Flu season
  • Present proof of MMR immunization or a positive MMR Titer
  • Testing and immunizations may be provided at a ProMedica site free of charge.
  • Volunteers must successfully complete the application process which includes the application, reference checks, interviews, background checks/fingerprinting and health requirements to receive an assignment.

You should also know:

  • Unfortunately, we are not equipped to handle short-term assignments. We encourage volunteers to meet our minimum time and service commitment.
  • We’ll do our best to honor assignments you request. Understand that our departments may not have open positions at the time of your application.
  • Some departments will not accept volunteers under the age of 18.
  • Departments/managers may ask to interview prospective volunteers and make decisions about your best placement.

Steps to Volunteering

  • First, complete our application at the link below.
  • We’ll review it and contact you upon approval.
  • After your application has been approved, we will contact you to set up an interview/orientation. At the interview/orientation, we will discuss open volunteer assignments and next steps.
  • Once your assignment has been chosen, we will pair you with a either a department employee or seasoned volunteer for training in your assignment.

To learn more about our volunteering or request an application, call 419-291-3648 or send an email to Regina.Mapstone@ProMedica.org.

Apply Online

ProMedica Bay Park Hospital Auxiliary

Our auxiliary is a group of dedicated individuals who volunteer for special events, fundraising, and projects that support our hospitals’ health and wellness mission. Consider joining us! For more information about our auxiliary, call 419-291-3648.
content.foundations:
Thanks to the generosity of many, our hospital is able to increase its impact on health in our community. ProMedica Bay Park Hospital Foundation directs these charitable contributions on behalf of Bay Park Hospital.

Give Online
content.PFAC:
About Patient and Family Advisory Council

Patient and Family Advisory Council (PFAC) is the voice for patients and their family members at ProMedica Bay Park Hospital. It is a collaborative partnership between patients, loved ones and hospital staff, to promote the concepts of Patient and Family Centered Care.

Council meetings are the starting point for patient and family advisors to share their perspectives on strategies, processes, and information together with hospital staff, and facilitate activities that enrich the patient and family experience during their hospital stay. The goal of the Patient and Family Advisory Council is to improve the safety and quality of patient care. Advisors can also participate in hospital councils, focus groups, and patient rounding.

Our PFACs serve as our richest source of capturing the voice of the customer and advocating to ensure we truly practice Patient and Family Centered Care.

PFAC meetings take place monthly at 6 p.m. at ProMedica Bay Park Hospital.

Frequently Asked Questions

What is a Patient/Family Advisor?

Patient and family advisors are individuals who have experienced care at one of our ProMedica hospitals as either a patient or a family member, and are willing to provide input from a patient’s perspective to improve care across our healthcare system.

What is the expectation of this role?

Patient and family advisors volunteer their time and perspective with staff and leaders. We ask PFAC members for their input on initiatives occurring at the hospital and across the ProMedica continuum of care.

What is the time commitment of a Patient or Family Advisor?

Patient and family advisors can commit to as little as one two-hour meeting each month or as often as weekly patient rounding.

How can I sign up to be a Patient or Family Advisor?

If you are interested in joining our team, please complete this form. We will connect you with the PFAC leader near you who will reach out and set up a time to meet and learn more about you.

If you would like to speak with someone related to your care, please contact: 419-690-7703

title: Cancer Center

content.imgAlt: ProMedica Bay Park Hospital - Cancer Center
content.name: ProMedica Bay Park Hospital - Cancer Center
content.description:
The Cancer Center in Oregon, Ohio

Located at 2801 Bay Park Dr in Oregon, OH, this region's leader in healthcare is dedicated to diagnosing and treating cancer patients while providing individualized healing plans and cancer therapy and rehab. Our cancer center team and expert healthcare staff, are committed to bringing integrative cancer care with a wide range of cancer care services, including early detection and diagnosis as well as medical oncology and outpatient infusion services like chemotherapy.

But, the true differentiator between the Cancer Center at ProMedica Bay Park Hospital compared to other healthcare systems, is the care and focus poured into each cancer patient. Cancer care through ProMedica offers support programs for patient families as well as patients to ensure a comforting process and transition.

About the ProMedica Bay Park Hospital Area

What is there to do outside?

  • Go fishing in Lake Erie
  • Relax at the Maumee Bay
  • Walk through the Pearson Metropark or Cullen Park
  • Check out Turtle Island on Lake Erie
  • See Toledo Harbor Lighthouse on Lake Erie
  • Sit by the water or play beach volleyball on the Maumee River Docks
  • Enjoy the nearby Toledo metro area

    • What restaurants are in the area?

    In a 15 mile radius from the hospital are delicious local and chain restaurants including:

    • Applebee’s Grill and Bar
    • Bob Evans
    • Burger King
    • Domino’s, Gino’s and Marco’s Pizza
    • Frisch’s Big Boy
    • KFC
    • Long John Silver’s
    • McDonald’s
    • Rally’s
    • Smokey’s BBQ Roadhouse
    • Tim Hortons
    • Tony Packo’s Cafe

    Don’t miss local spots:

    • The Cafe
    • Don’s Donut Shoppe
    • Maumee Bay Brewing
    • The Oliver House
    • The Oregon Inn

    Shopping:

    • Bartz Viviano Flowers and Gifts
    • Beth Allen’s Florist
    • Everything for Pets
    • Great Eastern Shopping Plaza
    • Meijer/Meijer Pharmacy
    • Menards
    • ProMedica Pharmcy

    When are the accommodations provided for me?

    Dedicated to providing the highest quality health care, the cancer center at ProMedica Bay Park campus features 72 private beds, a professional outpatient rehabilitation facility and a treatment and diagnostic center designed with your comfort and healing in mind with wider hallways, single-patient rooms, and an abundance of natural light. Sofa beds in patient rooms and birthing suites, with plenty of room for baby and other family members, are just two examples of how we put family first.

    Nearby hotels include:

    • Hampton Inn Oregon
    • Holiday Inn Express
    • Sleep Inn & Suites
    • Express Motel

    Campus Maps

    Download this printable campus map.

    Directions and Parking

    Ample parking is available in our lots. Park in any non-reserved space. Handicap-accessible spaces are located near all entrances. Or choose valet parking at the main entrance from 7 a.m. to 4:30 p.m., Monday through Friday. The cost is $3. Get driving directions.

    For directions to patient rooms and amenities, stop at our information desk located inside entrance #2 by the professional office building. Ask a member of our team for assistance. We’re happy to help.

title: Cancer Center

content.imgAlt: ProMedica Bay Park Hospital - Cancer Center
content.name: ProMedica Bay Park Hospital - Cancer Center
content.description:
The Cancer Center in Oregon, Ohio

Located at 2801 Bay Park Dr in Oregon, OH, this region's leader in healthcare is dedicated to diagnosing and treating cancer patients while providing individualized healing plans and cancer therapy and rehab. Our cancer center team and expert healthcare staff, are committed to bringing integrative cancer care with a wide range of cancer care services, including early detection and diagnosis as well as medical oncology and outpatient infusion services like chemotherapy.

But, the true differentiator between the Cancer Center at ProMedica Bay Park Hospital compared to other healthcare systems, is the care and focus poured into each cancer patient. Cancer care through ProMedica offers support programs for patient families as well as patients to ensure a comforting process and transition.

About the ProMedica Bay Park Hospital Area

What is there to do outside?

  • Go fishing in Lake Erie
  • Relax at the Maumee Bay
  • Walk through the Pearson Metropark or Cullen Park
  • Check out Turtle Island on Lake Erie
  • See Toledo Harbor Lighthouse on Lake Erie
  • Sit by the water or play beach volleyball on the Maumee River Docks
  • Enjoy the nearby Toledo metro area

    • What restaurants are in the area?

    In a 15 mile radius from the hospital are delicious local and chain restaurants including:

    • Applebee’s Grill and Bar
    • Bob Evans
    • Burger King
    • Domino’s, Gino’s and Marco’s Pizza
    • Frisch’s Big Boy
    • KFC
    • Long John Silver’s
    • McDonald’s
    • Rally’s
    • Smokey’s BBQ Roadhouse
    • Tim Hortons
    • Tony Packo’s Cafe

    Don’t miss local spots:

    • The Cafe
    • Don’s Donut Shoppe
    • Maumee Bay Brewing
    • The Oliver House
    • The Oregon Inn

    Shopping:

    • Bartz Viviano Flowers and Gifts
    • Beth Allen’s Florist
    • Everything for Pets
    • Great Eastern Shopping Plaza
    • Meijer/Meijer Pharmacy
    • Menards
    • ProMedica Pharmcy

    When are the accommodations provided for me?

    Dedicated to providing the highest quality health care, the cancer center at ProMedica Bay Park campus features 72 private beds, a professional outpatient rehabilitation facility and a treatment and diagnostic center designed with your comfort and healing in mind with wider hallways, single-patient rooms, and an abundance of natural light. Sofa beds in patient rooms and birthing suites, with plenty of room for baby and other family members, are just two examples of how we put family first.

    Nearby hotels include:

    • Hampton Inn Oregon
    • Holiday Inn Express
    • Sleep Inn & Suites
    • Express Motel

    Campus Maps

    Download this printable campus map.

    Directions and Parking

    Ample parking is available in our lots. Park in any non-reserved space. Handicap-accessible spaces are located near all entrances. Or choose valet parking at the main entrance from 7 a.m. to 4:30 p.m., Monday through Friday. The cost is $3. Get driving directions.

    For directions to patient rooms and amenities, stop at our information desk located inside entrance #2 by the professional office building. Ask a member of our team for assistance. We’re happy to help.

title: ProMedica Bay Park Hospital - Emergency Center 2801 Bay Park Drive, Oregon, Ohio (OH), 43616

content.imgAlt: ProMedica Bay Park Hospital - Emergency Center
content.name: ProMedica Bay Park Hospital - Emergency Center
content.description:
Experts in emergency medicine quickly get you the medical attention you need and will transfer you to more advanced care, if necessary. To contact the Emergency Center, call 419-690-7900. Call 9-1-1 immediately if you're experiencing a medical emergency.

The Emergency Center features:

  • 13 private beds
  • Three triage bays

    Along with typical emergencies, we are equipped to treat more critical patients by:

  • Offering PCI for interventional cardiology
  • Providing immediate diagnosis and treatment for stroke patients (Certified Primary Stroke Center)
  • Employing ICU physicians who are trained in critical care

For our most urgent cases, ProMedica Transportation Network (Air and Mobile) is available to transport patients who require the specialized treatment available at ProMedica Toledo Hospital.

Learn more about emergency services at ProMedica and download the “Know Where to Go” guide.

Pediatric Hematology/Oncology Program at Ebeid Children's Hospital - Advanced Monitoring Systems, Inpatient and Outpatient Services, Pediatric Hematology, Private, Pediatric Environment - 2142 N. Cove Blvd., Toledo, Ohio (OH), 43606

content.name: Pediatric Hematology/Oncology Program at Ebeid Children's Hospital
content.description:
The Pediatric Hematology/Oncology Program at the Debbie Brass Children’s Cancer Center located at ProMedica Russell J. Ebeid Children’s Hospital provides comprehensive, compassionate care and support for children diagnosed with cancer, blood disorders and bone marrow failure syndromes. From diagnosis through recovery, from newborns to young adults, our mission is to treat and cure cancer and blood diseases by understanding the special physical and emotional needs of both the patients and their families.

Our pediatric cancer center is the only member in the region of the Children’s Oncology Group (COG). COG is the world’s largest organization devoted exclusively to pediatric cancer clinical trials and research and is supported by the National Cancer Institute.

title: Pediatric Specialty Services - Muscular Dystrophy, Pediatric Down Syndrome, Pediatric Genetics, Pediatric Infectious Disease, Pediatric Neurology, Pediatric Physical Medicine, Pediatric Rehabilitation, Pediatric Rheumatology - 2150 W. Central Ave., Toledo, Ohio (OH), 43606

content.name: Pediatric Specialty Services
content.description:
ProMedica Pediatric Specialty Services makes it convenient to get expert, specialized care for children. We offer a wide range of services on the second floor of the Center for Health Services, close to ProMedica Russell J. Ebeid Children’s Hospital. Our family-centered care gives families access to leading-edge treatments from compassionate care teams.

Services We Provide

Pediatric Physical Medicine and Rehabilitation

Our pediatric physiatrist and healthcare staff coordinator provide care for children with physical disabilities to diagnose, treat and educate. We help them reach their functional goals to improve their quality of life.

Pediatric Genetics

Our affiliated pediatric geneticist and support team, including genetic counselors and registered nurse coordinators, provide care for children to diagnose, treat and provide education on pediatric genetic disorders.

Pediatric Rheumatology

Our affiliated pediatric rheumatologist and support team, including a RN coordinator and social worker, provide care for children to diagnose, treat and provide education on pediatric rheumatology disorders.

Adult and Pediatric Muscular Dystrophy Center

Our physiatrists and pediatric neurologist work with the Muscular Dystrophy Association and multi-disciplinary team that includes an orthopaedist, registered nurse coordinator, social worker and physical and occupational therapist. Together, they diagnose, treat, educate and coordinate care for patients with muscular dystrophy diseases.

Pediatric Neurology Seizure Clinic

Our pediatric neurologist and registered nurse coordinator diagnose, treat and pediatric patients with neurological diseases, with a special focus on seizure disorders.

Pediatric Down Syndrome Clinic

Our pediatric developmental specialist and registered nurse coordinator provide care for children with Down syndrome. We coordinate their care and help them reach their functional goals with an emphasis on quality of life.

Pediatric Infectious Disease

Our affiliated team of infectious disease specialists, including a physician, advanced practice provider, and registered nurse coordinator, diagnose, treat and provide education on children’s illnesses associated with infectious disease.

ProMedica Bay Park Hospital

content.name: ProMedica Bay Park Hospital
content.description:
Founded in 2001, ProMedica Bay Park Hospital is a community hospital serving the city of Oregon, Ohio, and our rural communities east of the Maumee River.

Our medical campus features:

  • A state-of-the-art hospital with 72 private beds.
  • A professional office building dedicated to doctors' offices and outpatient rehabilitation.
  • A treatment and diagnos​tic center.

ProMedica Bay Park Hospital was designed with your comfort and healing in mind, with wider hallways, single-patient rooms, and an abundance of natural light. Sofa beds in patient rooms and birthing suites, with plenty of room for baby and other family members, are just two examples of how we put family first.
content.volunteer:
Volunteers provide many meaningful services at Bay Park Hospital. Most importantly, they connect to our patients and their loved ones. By volunteering, you give your time and talents to your neighbors, and gain a sense of purpose and fulfillment. We thank you.

Valuable services to which you may contribute:

  • Guest guides.
  • Gift shop.
  • Support services.
  • Patient care services.
  • Advisory councils.

The Volunteer Resource Department helps the volunteer select an assignment that will best meet his/her talents and interests during the personal interview process. Some department directors reserve the right to interview prospective volunteers and make the final decision about their placement.

Volunteer Requirements

All volunteers must:

  • Be at least 16 years old.
  • Present proof of the 2nd Pfizer/Moderna vaccination or single dose of the Johnson & Johnson vaccination
  • Have a PPD 2-step/T-Stop (Tuberculin)
  • Present proof of Flu immunization during the Flu season
  • Present proof of MMR immunization or a positive MMR Titer
  • Testing and immunizations may be provided at a ProMedica site free of charge.
  • Volunteers must successfully complete the application process which includes the application, reference checks, interviews, background checks/fingerprinting and health requirements to receive an assignment.

You should also know:

  • Unfortunately, we are not equipped to handle short-term assignments. We encourage volunteers to meet our minimum time and service commitment.
  • We’ll do our best to honor assignments you request. Understand that our departments may not have open positions at the time of your application.
  • Some departments will not accept volunteers under the age of 18.
  • Departments/managers may ask to interview prospective volunteers and make decisions about your best placement.

Steps to Volunteering

  • First, complete our application at the link below.
  • We’ll review it and contact you upon approval.
  • After your application has been approved, we will contact you to set up an interview/orientation. At the interview/orientation, we will discuss open volunteer assignments and next steps.
  • Once your assignment has been chosen, we will pair you with a either a department employee or seasoned volunteer for training in your assignment.

To learn more about our volunteering or request an application, call 419-291-3648 or send an email to Regina.Mapstone@ProMedica.org.

Apply Online

ProMedica Bay Park Hospital Auxiliary

Our auxiliary is a group of dedicated individuals who volunteer for special events, fundraising, and projects that support our hospitals’ health and wellness mission. Consider joining us! For more information about our auxiliary, call 419-291-3648.
content.foundations:
Thanks to the generosity of many, our hospital is able to increase its impact on health in our community. ProMedica Bay Park Hospital Foundation directs these charitable contributions on behalf of Bay Park Hospital.

Give Online
content.PFAC:
About Patient and Family Advisory Council

Patient and Family Advisory Council (PFAC) is the voice for patients and their family members at ProMedica Bay Park Hospital. It is a collaborative partnership between patients, loved ones and hospital staff, to promote the concepts of Patient and Family Centered Care.

Council meetings are the starting point for patient and family advisors to share their perspectives on strategies, processes, and information together with hospital staff, and facilitate activities that enrich the patient and family experience during their hospital stay. The goal of the Patient and Family Advisory Council is to improve the safety and quality of patient care. Advisors can also participate in hospital councils, focus groups, and patient rounding.

Our PFACs serve as our richest source of capturing the voice of the customer and advocating to ensure we truly practice Patient and Family Centered Care.

PFAC meetings take place monthly at 6 p.m. at ProMedica Bay Park Hospital.

Frequently Asked Questions

What is a Patient/Family Advisor?

Patient and family advisors are individuals who have experienced care at one of our ProMedica hospitals as either a patient or a family member, and are willing to provide input from a patient’s perspective to improve care across our healthcare system.

What is the expectation of this role?

Patient and family advisors volunteer their time and perspective with staff and leaders. We ask PFAC members for their input on initiatives occurring at the hospital and across the ProMedica continuum of care.

What is the time commitment of a Patient or Family Advisor?

Patient and family advisors can commit to as little as one two-hour meeting each month or as often as weekly patient rounding.

How can I sign up to be a Patient or Family Advisor?

If you are interested in joining our team, please complete this form. We will connect you with the PFAC leader near you who will reach out and set up a time to meet and learn more about you.

If you would like to speak with someone related to your care, please contact: 419-690-7703

About the ProMedica Bay Park Hospital Area

What is there to do outside?

  • Go fishing in Lake Erie
  • Relax at the Maumee Bay
  • Walk through the Pearson Metropark or Cullen Park
  • Check out Turtle Island on Lake Erie

title: Cancer Center

content.imgAlt: ProMedica Bay Park Hospital - Cancer Center
content.name: ProMedica Bay Park Hospital - Cancer Center
content.description:
The Cancer Center in Oregon, Ohio

Located at 2801 Bay Park Dr in Oregon, OH, this region's leader in healthcare is dedicated to diagnosing and treating cancer patients while providing individualized healing plans and cancer therapy and rehab. Our cancer center team and expert healthcare staff, are committed to bringing integrative cancer care with a wide range of cancer care services, including early detection and diagnosis as well as medical oncology and outpatient infusion services like chemotherapy.

But, the true differentiator between the Cancer Center at ProMedica Bay Park Hospital compared to other healthcare systems, is the care and focus poured into each cancer patient. Cancer care through ProMedica offers support programs for patient families as well as patients to ensure a comforting process and transition.

title: ProMedica Bay Park Hospital - Emergency Center 2801 Bay Park Drive, Oregon, Ohio (OH), 43616

content.imgAlt: ProMedica Bay Park Hospital - Emergency Center
content.name: ProMedica Bay Park Hospital - Emergency Center
content.description:
Experts in emergency medicine quickly get you the medical attention you need and will transfer you to more advanced care, if necessary. To contact the Emergency Center, call 419-690-7900. Call 9-1-1 immediately if you're experiencing a medical emergency.

The Emergency Center features:

  • 13 private beds
  • Three triage bays

    Along with typical emergencies, we are equipped to treat more critical patients by:

  • Offering PCI for interventional cardiology
  • Providing immediate diagnosis and treatment for stroke patients (Certified Primary Stroke Center)
  • Employing ICU physicians who are trained in critical care

For our most urgent cases, ProMedica Transportation Network (Air and Mobile) is available to transport patients who require the specialized treatment available at ProMedica Toledo Hospital.

Learn more about emergency services at ProMedica and download the “Know Where to Go” guide.

Pediatric Hematology/Oncology Program at Ebeid Children's Hospital - Advanced Monitoring Systems, Inpatient and Outpatient Services, Pediatric Hematology, Private, Pediatric Environment - 2142 N. Cove Blvd., Toledo, Ohio (OH), 43606

content.name: Pediatric Hematology/Oncology Program at Ebeid Children's Hospital
content.description:
The Pediatric Hematology/Oncology Program at the Debbie Brass Children’s Cancer Center located at ProMedica Russell J. Ebeid Children’s Hospital provides comprehensive, compassionate care and support for children diagnosed with cancer, blood disorders and bone marrow failure syndromes. From diagnosis through recovery, from newborns to young adults, our mission is to treat and cure cancer and blood diseases by understanding the special physical and emotional needs of both the patients and their families.

Our pediatric cancer center is the only member in the region of the Children’s Oncology Group (COG). COG is the world’s largest organization devoted exclusively to pediatric cancer clinical trials and research and is supported by the National Cancer Institute.

title: Pediatric Specialty Services - Muscular Dystrophy, Pediatric Down Syndrome, Pediatric Genetics, Pediatric Infectious Disease, Pediatric Neurology, Pediatric Physical Medicine, Pediatric Rehabilitation, Pediatric Rheumatology - 2150 W. Central Ave., Toledo, Ohio (OH), 43606

content.name: Pediatric Specialty Services
content.description:
ProMedica Pediatric Specialty Services makes it convenient to get expert, specialized care for children. We offer a wide range of services on the second floor of the Center for Health Services, close to ProMedica Russell J. Ebeid Children’s Hospital. Our family-centered care gives families access to leading-edge treatments from compassionate care teams.

Services We Provide

Pediatric Physical Medicine and Rehabilitation

Our pediatric physiatrist and healthcare staff coordinator provide care for children with physical disabilities to diagnose, treat and educate. We help them reach their functional goals to improve their quality of life.

Pediatric Genetics

Our affiliated pediatric geneticist and support team, including genetic counselors and registered nurse coordinators, provide care for children to diagnose, treat and provide education on pediatric genetic disorders.

Pediatric Rheumatology

Our affiliated pediatric rheumatologist and support team, including a RN coordinator and social worker, provide care for children to diagnose, treat and provide education on pediatric rheumatology disorders.

Adult and Pediatric Muscular Dystrophy Center

Our physiatrists and pediatric neurologist work with the Muscular Dystrophy Association and multi-disciplinary team that includes an orthopaedist, registered nurse coordinator, social worker and physical and occupational therapist. Together, they diagnose, treat, educate and coordinate care for patients with muscular dystrophy diseases.

Pediatric Neurology Seizure Clinic

Our pediatric neurologist and registered nurse coordinator diagnose, treat and pediatric patients with neurological diseases, with a special focus on seizure disorders.

Pediatric Down Syndrome Clinic

Our pediatric developmental specialist and registered nurse coordinator provide care for children with Down syndrome. We coordinate their care and help them reach their functional goals with an emphasis on quality of life.

Pediatric Infectious Disease

Our affiliated team of infectious disease specialists, including a physician, advanced practice provider, and registered nurse coordinator, diagnose, treat and provide education on children’s illnesses associated with infectious disease.

ProMedica Bay Park Hospital

content.name: ProMedica Bay Park Hospital
content.description:
Founded in 2001, ProMedica Bay Park Hospital is a community hospital serving the city of Oregon, Ohio, and our rural communities east of the Maumee River.

Our medical campus features:

  • A state-of-the-art hospital with 72 private beds.
  • A professional office building dedicated to doctors' offices and outpatient rehabilitation.
  • A treatment and diagnos​tic center.

ProMedica Bay Park Hospital was designed with your comfort and healing in mind, with wider hallways, single-patient rooms, and an abundance of natural light. Sofa beds in patient rooms and birthing suites, with plenty of room for baby and other family members, are just two examples of how we put family first.
content.volunteer:
Volunteers provide many meaningful services at Bay Park Hospital. Most importantly, they connect to our patients and their loved ones. By volunteering, you give your time and talents to your neighbors, and gain a sense of purpose and fulfillment. We thank you.

Valuable services to which you may contribute:

  • Guest guides.
  • Gift shop.
  • Support services.
  • Patient care services.
  • Advisory councils.

The Volunteer Resource Department helps the volunteer select an assignment that will best meet his/her talents and interests during the personal interview process. Some department directors reserve the right to interview prospective volunteers and make the final decision about their placement.

Volunteer Requirements

All volunteers must:

  • Be at least 16 years old.
  • Present proof of the 2nd Pfizer/Moderna vaccination or single dose of the Johnson & Johnson vaccination
  • Have a PPD 2-step/T-Stop (Tuberculin)
  • Present proof of Flu immunization during the Flu season
  • Present proof of MMR immunization or a positive MMR Titer
  • Testing and immunizations may be provided at a ProMedica site free of charge.
  • Volunteers must successfully complete the application process which includes the application, reference checks, interviews, background checks/fingerprinting and health requirements to receive an assignment.

You should also know:

  • Unfortunately, we are not equipped to handle short-term assignments. We encourage volunteers to meet our minimum time and service commitment.
  • We’ll do our best to honor assignments you request. Understand that our departments may not have open positions at the time of your application.
  • Some departments will not accept volunteers under the age of 18.
  • Departments/managers may ask to interview prospective volunteers and make decisions about your best placement.

Steps to Volunteering

  • First, complete our application at the link below.
  • We’ll review it and contact you upon approval.
  • After your application has been approved, we will contact you to set up an interview/orientation. At the interview/orientation, we will discuss open volunteer assignments and next steps.
  • Once your assignment has been chosen, we will pair you with a either a department employee or seasoned volunteer for training in your assignment.

To learn more about our volunteering or request an application, call 419-291-3648 or send an email to Regina.Mapstone@ProMedica.org.

Apply Online

ProMedica Bay Park Hospital Auxiliary

Our auxiliary is a group of dedicated individuals who volunteer for special events, fundraising, and projects that support our hospitals’ health and wellness mission. Consider joining us! For more information about our auxiliary, call 419-291-3648.
content.foundations:
Thanks to the generosity of many, our hospital is able to increase its impact on health in our community. ProMedica Bay Park Hospital Foundation directs these charitable contributions on behalf of Bay Park Hospital.

Give Online
content.PFAC:
About Patient and Family Advisory Council

Patient and Family Advisory Council (PFAC) is the voice for patients and their family members at ProMedica Bay Park Hospital. It is a collaborative partnership between patients, loved ones and hospital staff, to promote the concepts of Patient and Family Centered Care.

Council meetings are the starting point for patient and family advisors to share their perspectives on strategies, processes, and information together with hospital staff, and facilitate activities that enrich the patient and family experience during their hospital stay. The goal of the Patient and Family Advisory Council is to improve the safety and quality of patient care. Advisors can also participate in hospital councils, focus groups, and patient rounding.

Our PFACs serve as our richest source of capturing the voice of the customer and advocating to ensure we truly practice Patient and Family Centered Care.

PFAC meetings take place monthly at 6 p.m. at ProMedica Bay Park Hospital.

Frequently Asked Questions

What is a Patient/Family Advisor?

Patient and family advisors are individuals who have experienced care at one of our ProMedica hospitals as either a patient or a family member, and are willing to provide input from a patient’s perspective to improve care across our healthcare system.

What is the expectation of this role?

Patient and family advisors volunteer their time and perspective with staff and leaders. We ask PFAC members for their input on initiatives occurring at the hospital and across the ProMedica continuum of care.

What is the time commitment of a Patient or Family Advisor?

Patient and family advisors can commit to as little as one two-hour meeting each month or as often as weekly patient rounding.

How can I sign up to be a Patient or Family Advisor?

If you are interested in joining our team, please complete this form. We will connect you with the PFAC leader near you who will reach out and set up a time to meet and learn more about you.

If you would like to speak with someone related to your care, please contact: 419-690-7703

Patient and family advisors can commit to as little as one two-hour meeting each month or as often as weekly patient rounding.

How can I sign up to be a Patient or Family Advisor?

If you are interested in joining our team, please complete this form. We will connect you with the PFAC leader near you who will reach out and set up a time to meet and learn more about you.

title: Cancer Center

content.imgAlt: ProMedica Bay Park Hospital - Cancer Center
content.name: ProMedica Bay Park Hospital - Cancer Center
content.description:
The Cancer Center in Oregon, Ohio

Located at 2801 Bay Park Dr in Oregon, OH, this region's leader in healthcare is dedicated to diagnosing and treating cancer patients while providing individualized healing plans and cancer therapy and rehab. Our cancer center team and expert healthcare staff, are committed to bringing integrative cancer care with a wide range of cancer care services, including early detection and diagnosis as well as medical oncology and outpatient infusion services like chemotherapy.

But, the true differentiator between the Cancer Center at ProMedica Bay Park Hospital compared to other healthcare systems, is the care and focus poured into each cancer patient. Cancer care through ProMedica offers support programs for patient families as well as patients to ensure a comforting process and transition.

About the ProMedica Bay Park Hospital Area

What is there to do outside?

  • Go fishing in Lake Erie
  • Relax at the Maumee Bay
  • Walk through the Pearson Metropark or Cullen Park
  • Check out Turtle Island on Lake Erie
  • See Toledo Harbor Lighthouse on Lake Erie
  • Sit by the water or play beach volleyball on the Maumee River Docks
  • Enjoy the nearby Toledo metro area

    • What restaurants are in the area?

    In a 15 mile radius from the hospital are delicious local and chain restaurants including:

    • Applebee’s Grill and Bar
    • Bob Evans
    • Burger King
    • Domino’s, Gino’s and Marco’s Pizza
    • Frisch’s Big Boy
    • KFC
    • Long John Silver’s
    • McDonald’s
    • Rally’s
    • Smokey’s BBQ Roadhouse
    • Tim Hortons
    • Tony Packo’s Cafe

    Don’t miss local spots:

    • The Cafe
    • Don’s Donut Shoppe
    • Maumee Bay Brewing
    • The Oliver House
    • The Oregon Inn

    Shopping:

    • Bartz Viviano Flowers and Gifts
    • Beth Allen’s Florist
    • Everything for Pets
    • Great Eastern Shopping Plaza
    • Meijer/Meijer Pharmacy
    • Menards
    • ProMedica Pharmcy

    When are the accommodations provided for me?

    Dedicated to providing the highest quality health care, the cancer center at ProMedica Bay Park campus features 72 private beds, a professional outpatient rehabilitation facility and a treatment and diagnostic center designed with your comfort and healing in mind with wider hallways, single-patient rooms, and an abundance of natural light. Sofa beds in patient rooms and birthing suites, with plenty of room for baby and other family members, are just two examples of how we put family first.

    Nearby hotels include:

    • Hampton Inn Oregon
    • Holiday Inn Express
    • Sleep Inn & Suites
    • Express Motel

    Campus Maps

    Download this printable campus map.

    Directions and Parking

    Ample parking is available in our lots. Park in any non-reserved space. Handicap-accessible spaces are located near all entrances. Or choose valet parking at the main entrance from 7 a.m. to 4:30 p.m., Monday through Friday. The cost is $3. Get driving directions.

    For directions to patient rooms and amenities, stop at our information desk located inside entrance #2 by the professional office building. Ask a member of our team for assistance. We’re happy to help.

providers.name: MONICA VASQUEZ MSN, APRN,
